New Records: Pete Alonso hit a game-winning three-run home run in the ninth inning of the deciding Game 3 of the Wild Card Series, securing the New York Mets' advancement to the Division Series
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso's ninth-inning three-run home run off Devin Williams was the decisive moment of the game
The Mets trailed by two runs before the bottom of the eighth inning but tied the game in the ninth
Jose Iglesias encouraged Pete Alonso before the inning and his message proved pivotal
Pre-Game Insights: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza expressed confidence in Pete Alonso's ability to come through in clutch moments
The Mets had been waiting for Alonso to have a big hit to end his slump
Post-Match Reflections: Jose Iglesias expressed pride in his ability to encourage Alonso and highlighted the victory as one of his happiest moments
Mets owner Steve Cohen praised Alonso's performance and the team's resilience
Miscellaneous Highlights: The victory marked a significant moment in Mets playoff history
Fans chanted 'Pete A-lon-so!' in celebration after the game
